name: indissociable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not able to be considered as separate or not connected: indissociable from The works that were performed at the theatre became indissociable from the building itself. She sees exercise and meditation as interconnected, indissociable processes.
More examplesFewer examplesHer name soon became indissociable from the campaigning organization that she founded.For many linguists, the words of a language are indissociable from the gestures that accompany them. These two aspects of the economy are indissociable, with each one dependent on and influencing the other.
